results.title: The Extraordinary experience of Nicholas Nodwell
results.brief_description: Nicholas is usually inattentive at school and likes to daydream. During a lesson on the production and uses of petroleum he finds himself transported into a strange world without petroleum. He learns how much our modern society depends on petroleum products. Script by Frank Colyer.

results.title: Expulsion
results.brief_description: A meticulous reconstruction of five crucial days in the life of a college for children in their last school year in Berkshire. A drug ring was discovered at the school. This led to mass expulsions, and to a tragic and unforeseen sequel. The film brings the problems of children and drugs to the fore and emphasises the need to take a stand on the issue.

results.title: Exploring your growth
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Heath Elementary Science
results.brief_description: Uses simple animation and photomicrography to explore the process that makes a person grow. Explains how food is digested in the mouth, stomach, and intestine; how the digested food is carried by the blood from the intestine to the cells of the body; and how food allows cells to grow and divide, causing growth.

results.title: Exploring the unwritten past
results.brief_description: A description of scientific investigation into the past, and modern techniques in archaeology. Shows how the fascinating story of man in Britain, covering the earliest discovery of the great antiquity of mankind in Kent’s Cavern in Devon to the decorative arts of the Celtic Iron age and the coming of the Romans, is being unravelled by experts. Illustrates the changing way of life through outstanding sites and monuments, together with objects which have played a part in piecing together the story.

results.title: Experiments with a bubble model of a metal structure
results.brief_description: A new version of Sir Lawrence Bragg’s famous analogue using bubbles on the surface of a liquid to demonstrate such phenomena as elastic and plastic deformation, dislocation and recrystallisation. A number of small bubbles of uniform size, blown on the surface of a soap solution, represents fairly accurately one cross-section of a metal structure. This bubble model is used to demonstrates the formation fo crystals in a metal, the slow production of larger crystals and the development of faults and slip planes.

results.title: Experiments in the revival of organisms (D)
results.brief_description: A record of successful Russian experiments in resuscitating dead animals. The apparatus used is shown and the resuscitation of a dead dog illustrated step by step. The film raises question about the true physiological nature of death. WARNING: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF ANIMAL EXPERIMENTATION.

results.title: An Experiment in towns
results.creator_credit: John Reeve, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the reasons why Britain has recently built fifteen towns - to give healthier working conditions, closer proximity to work, and enable “men to lunch in their own homes”. Explains how the planned towns are designed to allow safe play for children and creative leisure for adults. Shows the good design of individual homes.

results.title: Exeter
results.creator_credit: Gerald Budner, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Exeter Cathedral in Devonshire, England, is considered to be the finest example of architecture of the Decorated period, 1250-1350. This film rolls back the centuries, unfolding the cathedral’s history, showing the refinement of the sculpture that went into its building, from the airy vista of the nave (longest unbroken stretch of Gothic vaulting in the world), to the vibrant colors of its windows. But more than architecture survives, Exeter is still a living church for the people of today. Credits include: photography by Pierre Letarte, Reginald Morris, Richard Todd, Gilles Gascon; editing by Margaret Wescott; music by The Dunstable Consort; sound by Ted Haley, Jean-Guy Normandin and Peter Hearn.

results.title: Every five minutes
results.creator_credit: Max Anderson, John Taylor and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates causes of domestic outbreaks of fire and the precautions to be taken with them. Nearly all fires are caused by carelessness - leaving on electric appliances, using the wrong kind of fusewire, patching up electrical leads, leaving open fires unattended, and also leaving matches within reach of children. Emphasises that while fire brigades are highly trained, well equipped and within easy reach, the best cure for fire is prevention.

results.title: Ever since Giza
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film tells of the history of barley. A grain of antiquity - seeds were placed in the ancient pyramids of Giza. The experimental work done by Victorian and South Australian agencies to improve the barley crop through the development of more suitable varieties for areas of different climate, standard-isation of seed and better farming techniques is shown. This film was included in the San Francisco Film Festival 1964.
